intro: Scandix sylvestris, commonly known as the forest scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Scandix sylvestris is often found growing in nutrient-rich soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
